intro: Cephalophyllum subulatoides, commonly known as the spiny ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, spiny stems and small, clustered leaves that help it retain water in arid environments. The plant produces bright yellow flowers during the summer months, adding a striking visual contrast to its green foliage. Its adaptations make it well-suited for xerophytic conditions, and it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Cephalophyllum subulatoides is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its unique floral structures and succulent growth habits.
